Title:
Macrocybe indica comb. nov., an edible mushroom commercially
cultivated in tropical countries
Keywords: Calocybe, combination nova, Macrocybe, milky mushroom
Abstract:
Calocybe indica is an edible mushroom commercially
cultivated in tropical or subtropical Asian countries. Its
Tricholomatoid basidiocarp and brightly colored pileus are typical
characteristics of the genus Calocybe. However, the generic position has
been often doubted since C. indica was isolated from the other members
of the genus in earlier molecular studies. In the present study, the
natural taxonomic position of C. indica was reconsidered based on the
molecular phylogenetic analyses using nrITS ribosomal sequences. Our
result showed that samples of C. indica are separated from the other
Calocybe spp., but tightly clustered with Macrocybe spp. with strong
bootstrap supports. Based on the phylogenetic evidence, a new
combination Macrocybe indica was proposed.
